author: jezdez
message:
Fixed #16126 -- Added documentation about DELETE and ORDER fields in formsets. Many thanks to Aleksandra Sendecka.

git-svn-id: http://code.djangoproject.com/svn/django/trunk@16430 bcc190cf-cafb-0310-a4f2-bffc1f526a37

files.patch:
@@ -424,6 +424,33 @@ with the management form: The above ends up calling the ``as_table`` method on the formset class. +.. _manually-rendered-can-delete-and-can-order: + +Manually rendered ``can_delete`` and ``can_order`` +~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ + +If you manually render fields in the template, you can render +``can_delete`` parameter with ``{{ form.DELETE }}``: + +.. code-block:: html+django + +
+ {{ formset.management_form }} + {% for form in formset %} + {{ form.id }} +
    +
  • {{ form.title }}
    • + {% if formset.can_delete %} +
  • {{ form.DELETE }}
    • + {% enif %} +
+ {% endfor %} +
+ + +Similarly, if the formset has the ability to order (``can_order=True``), it is possible to render it +with ``{{ form.ORDER }}``. + Using more than one formset in a view ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

     ``inlineformset_factory`` uses ``modelformset_factory`` and marks
     ``can_delete=True``.
